snippet: ''We could sign it tomorrow if the United States wants to do it," said President Eveline Widmer-Schlumpf, who is also finance minister.
abstract: Swiss Pres Eveline Widmer-Schlumpf says country would sign a deal on banking secrecy with the United States immediately if not for an impasse created by Washington; relations between the US and Switzerland have been troubled by the question of tax evasion since 2008; Swiss say US has shown little interest in compromise, and is pursuing criminal investigations of 11 Swiss banks.

byline.contributor: David Kocieniewski contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: ''We could sign it tomorrow if the United States wants to do it," said President Eveline Widmer-Schlumpf, who is also finance minister.

headline.main: Swiss President Wants Tax Accord From U.S.
headline.print_headline: Swiss Continue to Seek Deal on Banking Secrecy
